thread.title: DIARY-Emerging Markets Economic Events to Sept 26
thread.title_full: DIARY-Emerging Markets Economic Events to Sept 26 | Reuters

author: Reuters
title: DIARY-Emerging Markets Economic Events to Sept 26
text:
Sept 16 (Reuters) -
For other diaries, please see:
Top economic events
Government debt auctions
Political and general news events
Index of all diaries
Guide to economic indicators
** This Diary is filed daily *** WEDNESDAY, SEPTEMBER 16 PARIS - Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development (OECD) updates key macroeconomic forecasts for major economies - 0900 GMT. SINGAPORE - Asian Development Bank President Takehiko Nakao speaks on Asian economic outlook and role of ADB - 0130 GMT. Nakao will also be attending the inaugural international conference on Evolving Finance, Trade and Investment in Asia AMSTERDAM - 4th OECD Forum on Tax and Crime (to Sept. 17). BANGKOK - Bank of Thailand holds monetary policy committee meeting - 0730 GMT. KAMPALA - Uganda to host the International Gas and Oil conference (to Sept. 17). Uganda President Yoweri Museveni and Finance Minister Matia Kasaija are the key speakers. SINGAPORE - Singapore Summit 2015 (to Sept. 19). Speakers:- Singapore Prime Minister Lee Hsien Loong, Indian chief economic adviser Arvind Subramanian, Philippines Finance Minister Cesar Purisima, Singapore's Former Foreign Minister George Yeo and Indian Finance Minister Arun Jaitley. THURSDAY, SEPTEMBER 17 ABIDJAN - Africa Islamic Finance Forum in Ivory Coast (to Sept. 18). Speakers:- Ivory Coast Prime Minister Daniel Kablan Duncan, Ivory Coast President Alassane Ouattara and Central Bank of West African States Governor Tiemoko Meyliet Kone. CAIRO - Central Bank of Egypt holds monetary policy committee meeting to announce interest rates - 0200 GMT. BUCHAREST - Annual seminar organized by an association of bank analysts on "Romania's economic outlook over the next decade". Romanian central bank Governor Mugur Isarescu is expected to attend the seminar. NEW DELHI - International Chamber of Commerce and the India Foundation are collaborating with the Indian government to host the India Economic Convention 2015. Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi, Finance Minister Arun Jaitley and junior Finance Minister Jayant Sinha will be speaking. FRIDAY, SEPTEMBER 18 LIMA - Central bank of Peru updates economic forecasts. MONDAY, SEPTEMBER 21 ABUJA - Central Bank of Nigeria holds monetary policy meeting (to Sept. 22). PRETORIA - South African Reserve Bank starts its three-day monetary policy committee meeting (to Sept. 23). MEXICO CITY - Central Bank of Mexico publishes monetary policy statement - 1800 GMT. TUESDAY, SEPTEMBER 22 BUDAPEST - Central bank of Hungary holds rate-setting meeting. NAIROBI - Central bank of Kenya announces rate decision. ABUJA - Central bank of Nigeria announces rate decision - 1330 GMT. WEDNESDAY, SEPTEMBER 23 PRETORIA - South African Reserve Bank announces rate decision - 1300 GMT. THURSDAY, SEPTEMBER 24 MANILA - Central bank of Philippines holds monetary policy meeting to announce interest rates - 0800 GMT. TAIPEI - Central Bank of the Republic of China (Taiwan) announces rate decision - 0900 GMT. PRAGUE - Czech National Bank holds monetary policy meeting to announce interest rates - 1100 GMT. JERUSALEM - Bank of Israel announces rate decision - 1300 GMT. SATURDAY, SEPTEMBER 26 CHISINAU - National bank of Moldova holds monetary policy meeting. An interest rate decision is expected.
